royal flush.placeholder: An ace-high straight flush, such as A♦ K♦ Q♦ J♦ 10♦, is called a royal flush or royal straight flush and is the best possible hand in ace-high games when wild cards are not used.

straight flush.placeholder: A straight flush is a hand that contains five cards of sequential rank, all of the same suit, such as Q♥ J♥ 10♥ 9♥ 8♥ (a 'queen-high straight flush').

4 of a kind.placeholder: Four of a kind, also known as quads, is a hand that contains four cards of one rank and one card of another rank (the kicker), such as 9♣ 9♠ 9♦ 9♥ J♥ ('four of a kind, nines').

full house.placeholder: A full house, also known as a full boat or a tight or a boat (and originally called a full hand), is a hand that contains three cards of one rank and two cards of another rank, such as 3♣ 3♠ 3♦ 6♣ 6♥ (a 'full house, threes over sixes' or 'threes full of sixes' or 'threes full').

flush.placeholder: A flush is a hand that contains five cards all of the same suit, not all of sequential rank, such as K♣ 10♣ 7♣ 6♣ 4♣ (a 'king-high flush' or a 'king-ten-high flush').

straight.placeholder: A straight is a hand that contains five cards of sequential rank, not all of the same suit, such as 7♣ 6♠ 5♠ 4♥ 3♥ (a 'seven-high straight').

3 of a kind.placeholder: Three of a kind, also known as trips or a set, is a hand that contains three cards of one rank and two cards of two other ranks (the kickers), such as 2♦ 2♠ 2♣ K♠ 6♥ ('three of a kind, twos' or 'trip twos' or a 'set of twos').

2 pair.placeholder: Two pair is a hand that contains two cards of one rank, two cards of another rank and one card of a third rank (the kicker), such as J♥ J♣ 4♣ 4♠ 9♥ ('two pair, jacks and fours' or 'two pair, jacks over fours' or 'jacks up').

jacks or better.placeholder: As the name suggests, you must have Jacks or better to receive a payout. A pair of Jacks pays 1x, so you are basically getting back the wager. This is also the case for a pair of Queens, Kings, or Aces. The actual ranking of the cards doesn’t matter as long as they meet the minimum hand requirement.
